question: AWS allows users to manage their resources using a web based user interface. What is the name of this interface?
explanation: The AWS Management Console is the web-based graphical interface used to manage and interact with AWS resources directly from a browser.

question: Which of the below options are related to the reliability of AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Applying the principle of least privilege to all AWS resources.
options.B: Automatically provisioning new resources to meet demand.
options.C: All AWS services are considered Global Services, and this design helps customers serve their international users.
options.D: Providing compensation to customers if issues occur.
options.E: Ability to recover quickly from failures.

explanation: Reliability in AWS is built on automatically provisioning resources to meet demand and the ability to recover quickly from failures — both ensure the system keeps running under varying conditions.

question: A company has developed an eCommerce web application in AWS. What should they do to ensure that the application has the highest level of availability?

options.A: Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and Edge locations.
options.B: Deploy the application across multiple Availability Zones and subnets.
options.C: Deploy the application across multiple Regions and Availability Zones.
options.D: Deploy the application across multiple VPC’s and subnets.

explanation: Deploying across multiple Regions and Availability Zones gives the highest availability by protecting against both AZ-level and Region-level failures.

question: What does AWS Snowball provide? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Built-in computing capabilities that allow customers to process data locally.
options.B: A catalog of third-party software solutions that customers need to build solutions and run their businesses.
options.C: A hybrid cloud storage between on-premises environments and the AWS Cloud.
options.D: An Exabyte-scale data transfer service that allows you to move extremely large amounts of data to AWS.
options.E: Secure transfer of large amounts of data into and out of the AWS.

explanation: AWS Snowball Edge includes built-in compute capabilities for local data processing, and securely transfers large amounts of data into and out of AWS — making it both a compute and data transfer appliance.

question: A company has decided to migrate its Oracle database to AWS. Which AWS service can help achieve this without negatively impacting the functionality of the source database?
explanation: AWS Database Migration Service (DMS) is purpose-built for migrating databases to AWS with minimal downtime, keeping the source database fully operational throughout the migration.

question: What are the benefits of having infrastructure hosted in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.B: There is no need to worry about security.
options.C: Gaining complete control over the physical infrastructure.
options.D: Operating applications on behalf of customers.
options.E: All of the physical security and most of the data/network security are taken care of for you.

explanation: AWS increases speed and agility by letting you provision resources in minutes, and handles physical security and most data/network security, so you can focus on building rather than infrastructure management.

question: What is the advantage of the AWS-recommended practice of "decoupling" applications?

options.A: Allows treating an application as a single, cohesive unit.
options.B: Reduces inter-dependencies so that failures do not impact other components of the application.
options.C: Allows updates of any monolithic application quickly and easily.
options.D: Allows tracking of any API call made to any AWS service.

explanation: Decoupling means designing components to operate independently, so a failure in one part does not cascade into failures across the rest of the application.

question: What should you do in order to keep the data on EBS volumes safe? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Regularly update firmware on EBS devices.
options.C: Ensure that EBS data is encrypted at rest.
options.D: Store a backup daily in an external drive.
options.E: Prevent any unauthorized access to AWS data centers.

explanation: EBS snapshots create point-in-time backups of your volume stored in S3, and enabling encryption at rest protects the data from unauthorized access — both are standard practices for EBS data protection.

question: What does Amazon CloudFront use to distribute content to global users with low latency?
explanation: CloudFront delivers content from Edge Locations — a global network of points of presence — caching content close to end users to minimize latency.

question: The identification process of an online financial services company requires that new users must complete an online interview with their security team. The completed recorded interviews are only required in the event of a legal issue or a regulatory compliance breach. What is the most cost-effective service to store the recorded videos?
explanation: S3 Glacier Deep Archive is the lowest-cost AWS storage class, designed for data that is rarely accessed and can tolerate retrieval times of hours — ideal for compliance archives that may never be needed.

question: Which service provides DNS in the AWS cloud?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWS's scalable and highly available Domain Name System (DNS) service, used to route end users to applications by translating domain names to IP addresses.

question: A company is deploying a new two-tier web application in AWS. Where should the most frequently accessed data be stored so that the application’s response time is optimal?
explanation: Amazon ElastiCache is an in-memory caching service that provides sub-millisecond response times for frequently accessed data, making it the best choice for optimizing application performance.

question: Which of the following can be described as a global content delivery network (CDN) service?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is AWS's global CDN service that caches and delivers content from Edge Locations worldwide, reducing latency for end users regardless of their location.

question: Which of the following are examples of AWS-Managed Services, where AWS is responsible for the operational and maintenance burdens of running the service? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB and Amazon EMR are fully managed services where AWS handles provisioning, patching, scaling, and maintenance. Unlike EC2 or VPC, customers do not manage the underlying infrastructure.

question: Your company has a data store application that requires access to a NoSQL database. Which AWS database offering would meet this requirement?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL key-value and document database, designed for applications that need fast, flexible, schema-less data storage.

question: In order to implement best practices when dealing with a “Single Point of Failure,” you should attempt to build as much automation as possible in both detecting and reacting to failure. Which of the following AWS services would help? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Elastic Load Balancing automatically detects unhealthy instances and stops sending traffic to them, while Auto Scaling replaces failed instances automatically — together they eliminate single points of failure.

question: A company is planning to host an educational website on AWS. Their video courses will be streamed all around the world. Which of the following AWS services will help achieve high transfer speeds?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that caches video content at Edge Locations around the world, delivering it to viewers from the nearest location and achieving high transfer speeds globally.

question: A developer is planning to build a two-tier web application that has a MySQL database layer. Which of the following AWS database services would provide automated backups for the application?

options.A: A MySQL database installed on an EC2 instance.

explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL-compatible managed relational database that automatically handles backups, replication, and failover, unlike running MySQL on EC2 where you manage everything yourself.

question: What is the AWS service that enables AWS architects to manage infrastructure as code?
explanation: AWS CloudFormation lets you define your entire AWS infrastructure as code using templates (JSON or YAML), enabling repeatable and automated provisioning of resources.

question: What does the AWS Health Dashboard provide? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Detailed troubleshooting guidance to address AWS events impacting your resources.
options.B: Health checks for Auto Scaling instances.
options.D: A dashboard detailing vulnerabilities in your applications.
options.E: Personalized view of AWS service health.

explanation: AWS Health Dashboard provides a personalized view of how AWS service events affect your specific resources, along with detailed troubleshooting guidance to help you respond to and resolve those events.

question: You have deployed your application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Your customers complain that sometimes they can’t reach your application. Which AWS service allows you to monitor the performance of your EC2 instances to assist in troubleshooting these issues?
explanation: Amazon CloudWatch collects and monitors metrics, logs, and events from EC2 instances, enabling you to set alarms and visualize performance data to diagnose availability and performance issues.

question: Your company is developing a critical web application in AWS, and the security of the application is a top priority. Which of the following AWS services will provide infrastructure security optimization recommendations?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor inspects your AWS environment and provides real-time recommendations across five categories including security, helping you follow AWS best practices to optimize your infrastructure.

question: Which of the following is not a benefit of Amazon S3? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Amazon S3 provides unlimited storage for any type of data.
options.B: Amazon S3 can run any type of application or backend system.
options.C: Amazon S3 stores any number of objects, but with object size limits.
options.D: Amazon S3 can be scaled manually to store and retrieve any amount of data from anywhere.
options.E: Amazon S3 provides 99.999999999% (11 9’s) of data durability.

explanation: S3 is object storage — it cannot run applications or backend systems (that's EC2/Lambda), and it scales automatically rather than manually. These two options misrepresent what S3 actually does.

question: What does AWS provide to deploy popular technologies such as IBM MQ on AWS with the least amount of effort and time?
explanation: AWS Quick Start reference deployments are pre-built templates and architecture guides that let you deploy popular third-party technologies on AWS quickly, with minimal manual setup.

question: Which of the following can an AWS customer use to launch a new Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) cluster? (Select TWO)
explanation: CloudFormation lets you define and launch RDS clusters as infrastructure-as-code, while the AWS Management Console provides a visual interface to create them directly. AWS Concierge, S3, and EC2 Auto Scaling are not used to launch RDS clusters.

question: Which of the following are features of Amazon CloudWatch Logs? (Select TWO)

options.A: Summaries by Amazon Simple Notification Service (Amazon SNS).

explanation: CloudWatch Logs supports real-time monitoring of log data and configurable retention periods (adjustable retention), so you control how long logs are kept. It is not free and does not summarize through SNS.

question: Which of the following is an AWS-managed compute service?
explanation: AWS Lambda is fully managed by AWS—you upload code and AWS handles all underlying compute infrastructure. EC2 requires you to manage the OS and capacity; Aurora is a database, not a compute service.

question: A company wants to reduce the physical compute footprint that developers use to run code. Which service would meet that need by enabling serverless architectures?
explanation: AWS Lambda runs code without requiring you to provision or manage any servers, directly reducing the physical compute footprint. EC2 still requires server management; DynamoDB is a database; CodeCommit is source control.

question: Which AWS services should be used for read/write of constantly changing data? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon RDS supports frequent read/write of relational data, while Amazon EFS provides a shared file system with concurrent read/write access. Glacier and Snowball are for archival/migration, and Redshift is optimized for analytical queries, not constant changes.

question: Which AWS service allows users to identify the changes made to a resource over time?
explanation: AWS Config continuously tracks and records configuration changes to AWS resources over time, allowing you to review historical configurations and identify what changed and when. Inspector checks for vulnerabilities; CloudTrail logs API calls.

question: According to best practices, how should an application be designed to run in the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS best practices recommend loosely coupled components so each part of an application can scale, fail, and be updated independently without cascading failures to other components.

question: Which of the following is an AWS managed Domain Name System (DNS) web service?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is AWS's managed DNS web service that translates domain names to IP addresses and also provides routing policies, health checks, and domain registration. Neptune is a graph database; SageMaker is ML; Lightsail is simplified VMs.

question: Which service is best for storing common database query results, which helps to alleviate database access load?
explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides in-memory caching (Redis or Memcached) that stores frequently queried results, dramatically reducing repeated database reads and lowering database load. SQS is for queuing; EC2 instance store is ephemeral block storage.

question: A company wants to focus on business activities instead of managing compute and capacity. Which AWS service can be used to automatically add or remove Amazon EC2 instances based on demand?
explanation: Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling monitors demand and automatically adds or removes EC2 instances to maintain performance and minimize cost, so the team can focus on the application rather than capacity management.

question: Which AWS service can be used to query stored datasets directly from Amazon S3 using standard SQL?
explanation: Amazon Athena lets you run standard SQL queries directly against data stored in S3 without loading it into a database. Glue is for ETL; Data Pipeline orchestrates data movement; CloudSearch is for search.

question: How does AWS shorten the time to provision IT resources?

options.A: It supplies an online IT ticketing platform for resource requests.
options.B: It supports automatic code validation services.
options.C: It provides the ability to programmatically provision existing resources.
options.D: It automates the resource request process from a company’s IT vendor list.

explanation: AWS allows you to provision resources programmatically through APIs, CloudFormation templates, and SDKs, drastically reducing the time to deploy infrastructure compared to traditional procurement and physical setup.

question: Which AWS services can be used to gather information about AWS account activity? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS CloudTrail logs all API calls and account activity, while Amazon CloudWatch collects metrics and log data from AWS services. Both provide visibility into account activity; CloudFront is a CDN; Cloud9 is an IDE; CloudHSM is hardware security module.

question: Which of the following are characteristics of Amazon S3? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 is an object store (stores objects with metadata and a key) and provides durable storage designed for 99.999999999% durability. It is not a file system, local file store, or network file system.

question: Which of the following services is in the category of AWS serverless platform?
explanation: AWS Lambda is the serverless compute service where you run code without managing servers. EMR runs Hadoop/Spark clusters; ELB distributes traffic; Mobile Hub was a configuration tool—none are the core serverless compute platform.

question: Which of the following inspects AWS environments to find opportunities that can save money for users and also improve system performance?
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor scans your AWS environment and provides recommendations across cost optimization, performance, security, fault tolerance, and service limits, helping save money and improve architecture.

question: What technology enables compute capacity to adjust as loads change?
explanation: Auto Scaling is the technology that monitors load and automatically adjusts the number of compute instances, ensuring capacity matches demand without manual intervention. Load balancing distributes traffic but doesn't change capacity.

question: Which AWS service is a managed NoSQL database?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is AWS's fully managed NoSQL database service that supports key-value and document data structures. Redshift is a data warehouse; Aurora and RDS for MariaDB are relational (SQL) databases.

question: What approach to transcoding a large number of individual video files adheres to AWS architecture principles?

options.B: Using a single large instance during off-peak hours.
options.D: Using a large GPU instance type.

explanation: AWS architecture principles favor horizontal scaling and parallelism. Transcoding many video files simultaneously using multiple parallel instances is faster and more cost-efficient than processing sequentially on one large instance.

question: Which AWS services can host a Microsoft SQL Server database? (Select TWO)
explanation: Microsoft SQL Server can run on EC2 instances (customer-managed) or be hosted via Amazon RDS for SQL Server (managed service). Aurora supports MySQL/PostgreSQL-compatible engines, not SQL Server; Redshift is a data warehouse; S3 is object storage.

question: The user is fully responsible for which action when running workloads on AWS?

options.D: Implementing controls to route application traffic.

explanation: When running workloads on AWS, customers are fully responsible for designing and implementing application-level controls such as routing application traffic. AWS manages infrastructure patching, physical controls, and the underlying network.

question: What time-savings advantage is offered with the use of Amazon Rekognition?

options.A: Amazon Rekognition provides automatic watermarking of images.
options.B: Amazon Rekognition provides automatic detection of objects appearing in pictures.
options.C: Amazon Recognition provides the ability to resize millions of images automatically.
options.D: Amazon Rekognition uses Amazon Mechanical Turk to allow humans to bid on object detection jobs.

explanation: Amazon Rekognition automatically analyzes images and videos to detect objects, scenes, faces, text, and activities, saving the time that would otherwise be spent on manual image review or building custom ML pipelines.

question: Which AWS service can be used to automatically scale an application up and down without making capacity planning decisions?
explanation: Amazon Auto Scaling (EC2 Auto Scaling) automatically adjusts the number of EC2 instances based on defined policies, eliminating the need for manual capacity planning decisions. Lambda is serverless event-driven compute, not a scaling service for existing apps.

question: Amazon Relational Database Service (Amazon RDS) offers which of the following benefits over traditional database management?

options.A: AWS manages the data stored in Amazon RDS tables.
options.B: AWS manages the maintenance of the operating system.
options.C: AWS automatically scales up instance types on demand.

explanation: With Amazon RDS, AWS manages the underlying operating system patching, backups, and maintenance windows, freeing customers from OS-level administration. Customers still manage the data, schema, and database-level configuration.

question: A company’s web application currently has light dependencies on underlying components so when one component fails the entire web application fails. Applying which AWS Cloud design principle will address the current design issue?

options.A: Implementing elasticity enabling the application to scale up or scale down as demand changes.
options.B: Enabling several EC2 instances to run in parallel to achieve better performance.
options.C: Focusing on decoupling components by isolating them and ensuring individual components can function when other components fail.
options.D: Doubling EC2 computing resources to increase system fault tolerance.

explanation: Decoupling components means isolating them so each can function independently; if one fails, others continue operating. This directly addresses tightly coupled architecture where a single failure brings down the whole application.

question: Which service stores objects, provides real-time access to those objects, and offers versioning and lifecycle capabilities?
explanation: Amazon S3 stores objects with real-time access, supports versioning to track and restore previous versions, and offers lifecycle policies to manage object transitions—making it the service that matches all three described capabilities.

question: Which service should a customer use to consolidate and centrally manage multiple AWS accounts?
explanation: AWS Organizations allows you to create a hierarchy of AWS accounts, consolidate billing, and apply governance policies (SCPs) centrally. IAM manages users/permissions within a single account; Config tracks configurations; Schema Conversion Tool is for database migration.

question: Which options does AWS make available for customers who want to learn about security in the cloud in an instructor-led setting? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Online Tech Talks are live and on-demand webinars that include Q&A, and AWS Classroom Training offers instructor-led courses—both are instructor-led or live settings. Blogs, forums, and Trusted Advisor are self-service resources, not instructor-led.

question: Which of the following features can be configured through the Amazon Virtual Private Cloud (Amazon VPC) Dashboard? (Select TWO)
explanation: Security Groups (stateful firewall rules for instances) and Subnets (network segmentation) are core VPC components configured via the VPC Dashboard. CloudFront, Route 53, and ELB are separate services with their own dashboards.

question: Which of the following common IT tasks can AWS cover to free up company IT resources? (Select TWO)
explanation: For managed database services like RDS, AWS handles OS patching and automated backups on behalf of the customer, freeing IT teams from these routine tasks. Application testing, schema creation, and penetration testing remain customer responsibilities.

question: Why is it beneficial to use Elastic Load Balancers with applications?

options.A: They allow for the conversion from Application Load.
options.C: They are capable of handling constant changes in network traffic patterns.
options.D: They automatically adjust capacity. They are provided at no charge to users.

explanation: Elastic Load Balancers automatically distribute incoming traffic across multiple targets and adapt to changing traffic patterns without manual intervention, ensuring no single target is overwhelmed. ELB is not free, and it does not convert between load balancer types.

question: What AWS team assists customers with accelerating cloud adoption through paid engagements in any of several specialty practice areas?
explanation: AWS Professional Services is a global team of experts that helps customers achieve their desired business outcomes on AWS through paid engagements. Solutions Architects advise on architecture; Account Managers handle relationships; Enterprise Support is a support tier, not a consulting engagement.

question: If a customer needs to audit the change management of AWS resources, which of the following AWS services should the customer use?
explanation: AWS Config continuously records resource configurations and changes over time, providing a detailed audit trail of what changed, when, and who made the change. CloudTrail records API calls; CloudWatch monitors metrics; Inspector checks for vulnerabilities.

question: Which AWS managed service is used to host databases?
explanation: Amazon RDS is AWS's fully managed relational database service that supports multiple database engines (MySQL, PostgreSQL, Oracle, SQL Server, etc.). AWS Batch is for batch computing; Artifact is for compliance documents; Data Pipeline orchestrates data movement.

question: Which AWS service provides a simple and scalable shared file storage solution for use with Linux-based AWS and on-premises servers?
explanation: Amazon EFS is a managed NFS file system that can be mounted by multiple Linux EC2 instances simultaneously and also accessed from on-premises servers, providing simple, scalable shared file storage. S3 and Glacier are object stores; EBS volumes attach to a single instance.

question: Which of the following is a shared control between the customer and AWS?

options.A: Providing a key for Amazon S3 client-side encryption.
options.B: Configuration of an Amazon EC2 instance.
options.C: Environmental controls of physical AWS data centers.

explanation: Awareness and training is a shared control—both AWS and the customer must independently ensure their respective staff understands security responsibilities. Client-side encryption keys, EC2 configuration, and physical data center controls are either solely customer or solely AWS responsibilities.

question: Which type of AWS storage is ephemeral and is deleted when an instance is stopped Of terminated?
explanation: EC2 instance store is physically attached to the host and provides ephemeral block storage that is lost when the instance stops or terminates. EBS volumes persist independently of the instance lifecycle; EFS and S3 are network-accessible and durable.

question: Which services are parts of the AWS serverless platform?

options.A: Amazon EC2, Amazon S3, Amazon Athena.
options.B: Amazon Kinesis, Amazon SQS, Amazon EMR.
options.C: AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, Amazon SNS.
options.D: Amazon Athena, Amazon Cognito, Amazon EC2.

explanation: AWS Step Functions, Amazon DynamoDB, and Amazon SNS are all serverless services—they require no server provisioning and scale automatically. Amazon EC2 and EMR require server management; Kinesis and SQS are managed but not purely serverless in the same category.

question: Which AWS service provides the ability to manage infrastructure as code?
explanation: AWS CloudFormation allows you to define AWS infrastructure in JSON or YAML templates (infrastructure as code), enabling repeatable, automated provisioning. CodePipeline automates CI/CD; CodeDeploy deploys application code; Direct Connect provides dedicated network connectivity.

question: A customer needs to run a MySQL database that easily scales. Which AWS service should they use?
explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database built for the cloud that automatically scales storage and can handle high throughput. Redshift is a data warehouse; DynamoDB is NoSQL; ElastiCache is an in-memory cache.

question: Which of the following is an AWS Cloud architecture design principle?
explanation: Loose coupling is a core AWS cloud architecture principle where components interact through well-defined interfaces, allowing each to scale, update, or fail independently without cascading effects. Tight coupling, monolithic design, and vertical scaling are anti-patterns for cloud-native architectures.

question: Which of the following AWS services can be used to serve large amounts of online video content with the lowest possible latency? (Select TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 and Amazon CloudFront together provide scalable, globally distributed video delivery: S3 stores the content and CloudFront's edge locations cache and deliver it to users worldwide with low latency. EFS is a file system; Glacier is for archival; API Gateway is for APIs.

question: Which AWS service provides a customized view of the health of specific AWS services that power a customer’s workloads running on AWS?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard provides a personalized view of the health of the specific AWS services being used by your account, including alerts about events that may affect your resources. The Service Health Dashboard shows global service status; CloudWatch monitors metrics; X-Ray traces application performance.

question: Which AWS service provides alerts when an AWS event may impact a company’s AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Personal Health Dashboard sends personalized alerts and remediation guidance when AWS events might affect specific resources in your account. The Service Health Dashboard shows broad, general AWS service status without personalization to your specific resources.

question: Which service’s PRIMARY purpose is software version control?
explanation: AWS CodeCommit is a fully managed Git-based source control service designed specifically for software version control. CodeStar is a project management dashboard; the CLI is a command-line interface; Cognito is for user authentication.

question: How can a customer increase security to AWS account logons? (Select TWO)

options.C: Use Amazon Cognito to manage access

explanation: Enabling MFA requires a second factor (e.g., a virtual authenticator app) beyond the password, and a strong password policy enforces complexity, length, and rotation—both directly strengthen account logon security. Cognito manages app user pools; Organizations manages multi-account governance; Certificate Manager handles SSL/TLS certificates.

question: What can assist in evaluating an application for migration to the cloud? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Professional Services provides expert consulting engagements to help evaluate and plan migrations, and AWS Partner Network (APN) partners offer specialized migration expertise. Trusted Advisor checks best practices but doesn't evaluate migration fit; Systems Manager and Secrets Manager are operational tools, not migration advisory services.

question: Which of the following are valid ways for a customer to interact with AWS services? (Select TWO)
explanation: The AWS CLI allows programmatic control of services from the command line, and SDKs enable interaction from within application code in various programming languages. On-premises, SaaS, and hybrid describe deployment models, not interaction methods with AWS APIs.

question: What is a value proposition of the AWS Cloud?

options.A: AWS is responsible for security in the AWS Cloud.
options.D: AWS manages user applications in the AWS Cloud.

explanation: One of AWS's core value propositions is the absence of long-term contracts—customers can use services on a pay-as-you-go basis and stop at any time. AWS does not manage user applications; provisioning in minutes (not days) is the reality; and security is a shared responsibility.

question: Which AWS service is used to track record, and audit configuration changes made to AWS resources?
explanation: AWS Config continuously records configuration changes to AWS resources and maintains a history of those changes, enabling audit and compliance reviews. Shield is for DDoS protection; IAM manages identities; Inspector assesses application vulnerabilities.

question: Which feature of the AWS Cloud will support an international company’s requirement for low latency to all of its customers?
explanation: AWS's global reach—its worldwide network of Regions and edge locations—enables companies to deploy applications and serve content close to users anywhere in the world, reducing latency. Fault tolerance and high availability address uptime, not geographic proximity; pay-as-you-go is a pricing model.

question: Which of the following services falls under the responsibility of the customer to maintain operating system configuration, security patching, and networking?
explanation: With Amazon EC2, the customer is responsible for the guest OS, including configuration, security patching, and networking setup. With fully managed services like RDS, ElastiCache, and Fargate, AWS handles the OS-level maintenance on the customer's behalf.

question: Which service provides a hybrid storage service that enables on-premises applications to seamlessly use cloud storage?
explanation: AWS Storage Gateway is a hybrid storage service that integrates on-premises environments with AWS cloud storage, presenting cloud storage as local file shares, volumes, or tape to on-premises applications. Glacier is archival storage; Snowball is for physical data migration; EBS is block storage for EC2.

question: Where should a company go to search software listings from independent software vendors to find, test, buy and deploy software that runs on AWS?
explanation: AWS Marketplace is the curated digital catalog where independent software vendors list their products, allowing customers to find, test, buy, and deploy software that runs on AWS. Artifact is for compliance documents; Lumberyard is a game engine; CloudSearch is a managed search service.

question: Which of the following security-related services does AWS offer? (Select TWO)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor includes security checks (such as identifying open security groups) and AWS provides data encryption capabilities (KMS, S3 encryption, etc.) as security-related services. AWS does not provide physical MFA tokens, perform automated penetration testing, or detect copyrighted content in S3.

question: Which of the following AWS features enables a user to launch a pre-configured Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2) instance?
explanation: An Amazon Machine Image (AMI) is a pre-configured template containing the OS, application server, and application code that is used to launch a new EC2 instance in a known state. EBS provides storage; EC2 Systems Manager manages running instances; AppStream 2.0 streams desktop applications.

question: A solution that is able to support growth in users, traffic, or data size with no drop in performance aligns with which cloud architecture principle?
explanation: Elasticity is the ability to scale resources up or down automatically to handle increases in users, traffic, or data without degrading performance. 'Think parallel' and 'decouple components' are separate principles; 'design for failure' addresses resilience, not growth handling.

question: Which AWS Cloud benefit eliminates the need for users to try estimating future infrastructure usage?

options.A: Easy and fast deployment of applications in multiple Regions around the world.
options.D: Lower variable costs due to massive economies of scale.

explanation: Cloud elasticity means you can scale resources up or down on demand, eliminating the need to predict and provision for peak future capacity in advance. Security, global deployment, and lower costs are benefits but do not specifically eliminate the need for capacity estimation.

question: Which AWS service would a customer use with a static website to achieve tower latency and high transfer speeds?
explanation: Amazon CloudFront is a CDN that caches static website content at edge locations worldwide, delivering it to users with low latency and high transfer speeds. Lambda is serverless compute; DynamoDB Accelerator caches database queries; Route 53 is DNS.

question: How do Amazon EC2 Auto Scaling groups help achieve high availability for a web application?

options.A: They automatically add more instances across multiple AWS Regions based on global demand of the application.
options.B: They automatically add or replace instances across multiple Availability Zones when the application needs it.
options.C: They enable the application’s stalk: content to reside closer to end users.
options.D: They are able to distribute incoming requests across a tier of web server instances.

explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling groups span multiple Availability Zones and automatically add replacement instances when existing ones fail or become unhealthy, maintaining the desired capacity and enabling high availability. Auto Scaling does not operate across Regions or serve as a load balancer or CDN.

question: Which of the following can limit Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket access to specific users?

options.C: AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) policies.

explanation: IAM policies attached to users, groups, or roles precisely control which principals can access specific S3 buckets and objects. Security groups control network-level access to EC2 instances, not S3; Inspector scans for vulnerabilities; key pairs are for EC2 SSH access.

question: Which of the following tasks is the responsibility of AWS?

options.B: Configuring AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) roles.

explanation: Under the shared responsibility model, AWS is responsible for securing the underlying hypervisor that runs EC2 virtual machines. Customers are responsible for client-side data encryption, configuring IAM roles, and setting password policies.

question: A company is looking for a scalable data warehouse solution. Which of the following AWS solutions would meet the company’s needs?
explanation: Amazon Redshift is AWS's fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse service designed for complex analytical queries across large datasets. S3 is object storage; DynamoDB is NoSQL; Kinesis is for real-time streaming data.

question: What are the advantages of the AWS Cloud (Select TWO)

options.B: No need to guess capacity requirements.
options.E: Physical access to cloud data centers.

explanation: The AWS Cloud eliminates the need to guess capacity (elasticity scales automatically to demand), and it dramatically increases speed to market by making infrastructure available in minutes rather than weeks. Costs are variable (not fixed), capex is reduced (not increased), and physical data center access is not available to customers.

question: Which AWS security service protects applications from distributed denial of service attacks with always-on detection and automatic inline mitigations?
explanation: AWS Shield is a managed DDoS protection service that provides always-on detection and automatic inline mitigation to protect applications from DDoS attacks. WAF filters web application traffic; ELB distributes traffic; Inspector scans for vulnerabilities.

question: Which service provides object-level storage in AWS?
explanation: Amazon S3 is AWS's object storage service, where each item is stored as an object (data + metadata + key) in a bucket. EBS and instance store provide block storage; EFS provides file storage—none are object-level storage.

question: Which S3 storage class is best for data with unpredictable access patterns?
explanation: S3 Intelligent-Tiering automatically moves objects between access tiers based on changing access patterns, optimizing costs when access frequency is unpredictable—without retrieval fees. Standard is best for frequent access; S3-IA incurs retrieval fees; Glacier is for archival with long retrieval times.

question: What is the AWS database service that allows you to upload data structured in key-value format?
explanation: Amazon DynamoDB is a fully managed NoSQL database that natively supports key-value and document data models, making it ideal for uploading and retrieving data structured as key-value pairs. Aurora and RDS are relational (SQL) databases; Redshift is a data warehouse.

question: A company has moved to AWS recently. Which of the following AWS Services will help ensure that they have the proper security settings? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS Trusted Advisor checks your environment against security best practices (like open security groups and public S3 buckets), and Amazon Inspector automatically assesses EC2 instances for vulnerabilities and deviations from best practices. SNS is a notification service; CloudWatch monitors metrics; Concierge is a billing support team.

question: Which of the below is a best-practice when designing solutions on AWS?

options.A: Invest heavily in architecting your environment, as it is not easy to change your design later.
options.B: Use AWS reservations to reduce costs when testing your production environment.
options.C: Automate wherever possible to make architectural (© ) experimentation easier.
options.D: Provision a large compute capacity to handle any spikes in load

explanation: AWS best practice is to automate infrastructure and deployment wherever possible, which makes architectural experimentation faster and reduces human error. Investing heavily in upfront design, using Reserved Instances for testing, and over-provisioning are all anti-patterns in a cloud-native approach.

question: Which service is used to ensure that messages between software components are not lost if one or more components fail?
explanation: Amazon SQS is a fully managed message queuing service that stores messages even when the consuming component is unavailable, preventing message loss in distributed architectures. SES is for email; Direct Connect provides dedicated network connectivity; Amazon Connect is a contact center service.

question: The principle “design for failure and nothing will fail” is very important when designing your AWS Cloud architecture. Which of the following would help adhere to this principle? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Availability Zones provide physical redundancy so that if one AZ fails, another continues to serve traffic. Elastic Load Balancing automatically detects unhealthy targets and routes traffic only to healthy ones, preventing a single failed instance from bringing down the application. MFA, penetration testing, and vertical scaling do not directly contribute to fault tolerance in application design.

question: What is the AWS service that provides a virtual network dedicated to your AWS account?
explanation: Amazon VPC (Virtual Private Cloud) creates a logically isolated, private network within AWS that is dedicated to your account, where you control IP addressing, subnets, routing, and gateways. AWS VPN is a connectivity feature; Subnets are components within a VPC; Dedicated Hosts are physical servers, not a networking construct.

question: Which of the following AWS services can be used as a compute resource? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon EC2 provides resizable virtual servers (compute) and AWS Lambda runs code as serverless functions—both are compute resources. VPC is a networking service; CloudWatch is monitoring; S3 is object storage.

question: Your company is designing a new application that will store and retrieve photos and videos. Which of the following services should you recommend as the underlying storage mechanism?
explanation: Amazon S3 is designed for storing and retrieving any amount of unstructured data, including photos and videos, with high durability and scalability. EBS is block storage attached to EC2 instances; SQS is a message queue; EC2 instance store is ephemeral and not suited for persistent photo/video storage.

question: What does Amazon ElastiCache provide?

options.B: An Ehcache compatible in-memory data store.
options.C: An online software store that allows Customers to launch pre-configured software with just few clicks.
options.D: A domain name system in the cloud.

explanation: Amazon ElastiCache provides in-memory caching (Redis or Memcached) that stores frequently accessed data in RAM, delivering sub-millisecond read latency for read-heavy applications. It is not an online software store (that is AWS Marketplace), a DNS service (that is Route 53), or an Ehcache-compatible store specifically.

question: What is the AWS service that enables you to manage all of your AWS accounts from a single master account?
explanation: AWS Organizations enables you to create a hierarchy of AWS accounts managed from a single master (management) account, applying policies and consolidated billing across all member accounts. WAF filters web traffic; Trusted Advisor gives recommendations; Amazon Config tracks resource configurations.

question: Which of the following are important design principles you should adopt when designing systems on AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Always use Global Services in your architecture rather than Regional Services.
options.B: Always choose to pay as you go.

explanation: Automation (e.g., CloudFormation, Auto Scaling) reduces manual errors and speeds recovery, and removing single points of failure through redundancy ensures continued operation if one component fails—both are core AWS design principles. Using only Global Services limits flexibility; always paying as you go is a pricing principle, not a design principle; treating servers as fixed resources contradicts elasticity.

question: Which AWS Service can be used to establish a dedicated, private network connection between AWS and your datacenter?
explanation: AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated, private physical network connection between your on-premises datacenter and AWS, bypassing the public internet for more consistent bandwidth and lower latency. CloudFront is a CDN; Snowball is for data transfer via physical appliance; Route 53 is a DNS service.

question: You are working on two projects that require completely different network configurations. Which AWS service or feature will allow you to isolate resources and network configurations?
explanation: Amazon VPC lets you provision logically isolated network environments within AWS, with full control over IP ranges, subnets, routing tables, and gateways—allowing you to run completely separate network configurations for different projects. Internet gateways enable internet access within a VPC; security groups control instance-level traffic; CloudFront is a CDN.

question: An organization needs to analyze and process a large number of data sets. Which AWS service should they use?
explanation: Amazon EMR (Elastic MapReduce) is AWS's managed big data platform that runs Apache Hadoop, Spark, and other frameworks for processing and analyzing large datasets. Amazon MQ is a managed message broker; SNS is a notification service; SQS is a message queue—none are suited for large-scale data analytics.

question: What is the AWS service that provides you the highest level of control over the underlying virtual infrastructure?
explanation: Amazon EC2 gives customers the highest level of control over the virtual infrastructure: choice of OS, instance type, networking, storage, and the ability to install and configure any software. RDS, DynamoDB, and Redshift are managed services where AWS abstracts much of the underlying infrastructure from the customer.

question: Which statement best describes the operational excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

options.A: The ability of a system to recover gracefully from failure.
options.B: The efficient use of computing resources to meet requirements.
options.C: The ability to monitor systems and improve supporting processes and procedures.
options.D: The ability to manage datacenter operations more efficiently.

explanation: The Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework focuses on running and monitoring workloads effectively, continuously improving processes, and automating operations to deliver business value. Graceful recovery from failure describes Reliability; efficient resource use describes Performance Efficiency; datacenter management is not a Well-Architected pillar.

question: What are the change management tools that helps AWS customers audit and monitor all resource changes in their AWS environment? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS CloudTrail records all API calls and account activity, providing an audit log of who did what and when. AWS Config records configuration changes to resources over time and can evaluate compliance against desired configurations. Together they provide comprehensive change management visibility. Comprehend is NLP; Transit Gateway manages VPC connectivity; X-Ray traces application requests.

question: Which of the following services allows you to run containerized applications on a cluster of EC2 instances?
explanation: Amazon ECS (Elastic Container Service) is a fully managed container orchestration service that allows you to run and manage Docker containers on a cluster of EC2 instances or using Fargate. AWS Data Pipeline orchestrates data movement; Cloud9 is an IDE; Personal Health Dashboard shows AWS service health events.

question: What are the AWS services/features that can help you maintain a highly available and fault-tolerant architecture in AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: EC2 Auto Scaling automatically adds or removes instances based on demand, maintaining availability when traffic spikes or instances fail. Elastic Load Balancer distributes traffic across healthy instances and integrates with Auto Scaling to replace unhealthy ones. Direct Connect is a networking service; CloudFormation provisions infrastructure; NACLs control network access but do not improve availability.

question: What is the AWS service/feature that takes advantage of Amazon CloudFront’s globally distributed edge locations to transfer files to S3 with higher upload speeds?
explanation: S3 Transfer Acceleration uses CloudFront's globally distributed edge locations as entry points for uploads to S3, routing data over AWS's optimized backbone network to reach the target S3 bucket faster. AWS WAF filters web traffic; Snowmobile and Snowball are physical data transfer appliances for bulk migrations.

question: Which AWS services can be used to improve the performance of a global application and reduce latency for its users? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS Global Accelerator improves global application performance by routing user traffic through AWS's private backbone network to the nearest healthy endpoint, reducing internet latency. Amazon CloudFront caches and serves content from edge locations worldwide, also reducing latency for users. KMS is encryption key management; Direct Connect is a private network link; Glue is an ETL service.

question: A company has created a solution that helps AWS customers improve their architectures on AWS. Which AWS program may support this company?
explanation: APN Consulting Partners are professional services firms certified by AWS to design, build, and manage customer workloads on AWS—including solutions that help other customers improve their architectures. AWS TAMs and Professional Services are direct AWS resources, not partner firms; APN Technology Partners provide software products, not consulting services.

question: What is the AWS serverless service that allows you to run your applications without any administrative burden?
explanation: AWS Lambda is the serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events without requiring you to provision, manage, or scale any servers or infrastructure. Lightsail simplifies VM management but still involves server concepts; RDS and EC2 both require server management.

question: Jessica is managing an e-commerce web application in AWS. The application is hosted on six EC2 instances. One day, three of the instances crashed; but none of her customers were affected. What has Jessica done correctly in this scenario?

options.A: She has properly built an elastic system.
options.B: She has properly built a fault tolerant system.
options.C: She has properly built an encrypted system.
options.D: She has properly built a scalable system.

explanation: A fault-tolerant system is one designed to continue operating correctly even when some of its components fail—exactly the scenario described where three of six instances crashed but no customers were affected. Elastic systems scale with demand; encrypted systems protect data; scalable systems handle growth—none specifically describe continued operation during component failure.

question: Where can you store files in AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon EFS (Elastic File System) is a managed NFS file storage service accessible by multiple EC2 instances simultaneously. Amazon EBS provides block-level storage volumes that can be attached to EC2 instances. SNS is a notification service; ECS is for containers; EMR is for big data processing—none are file storage services.

question: Which AWS service can be used to store and reliably deliver messages across distributed systems?
explanation: Amazon SQS (Simple Queue Service) is a fully managed message queuing service that stores messages reliably until they are processed, ensuring no message is lost even if one or more components in the system temporarily fail. Storage Gateway connects on-premises environments to AWS storage; SES sends emails; S3 stores objects.

question: What is the primary storage service used by Amazon RDS database instances?
explanation: Amazon RDS database instances use Amazon EBS volumes as their primary storage layer, providing persistent, block-level storage that persists independently of the database instance lifecycle. Glacier is archival storage; EFS is a file system; S3 is object storage—none serve as the primary storage for RDS instances.

question: A company is developing a new application using a microservices framework. The new application is having performance and latency issues. Which AWS Service should be used to troubleshoot these issues?
explanation: AWS X-Ray provides distributed tracing for applications, allowing developers to visualize the end-to-end path of requests across microservices, identify bottlenecks, and diagnose latency and performance issues. CodePipeline automates CI/CD; Inspector checks for security vulnerabilities; CloudTrail logs API calls.

question: What are the Amazon RDS features that can be used to improve the availability of your database? (Choose TWO)
explanation: RDS Multi-AZ Deployment maintains a synchronous standby replica in a different AZ, enabling automatic failover if the primary instance fails. Read Replicas serve read traffic and can be promoted to a standalone database, improving availability for read-heavy workloads. Regions expand geographic reach; automatic patching reduces admin burden; edge locations are not part of RDS.

question: Which of the below is a best-practice when building applications on AWS?

options.A: Strengthen physical security by applying the principle of least privilege.
options.B: Ensure that the application runs on hardware from trusted vendors.
options.C: Use IAM policies to maintain performance.
options.D: Decouple the components of the application so that they run independently.

explanation: Decoupling application components—so they communicate through well-defined interfaces like APIs or queues rather than direct dependencies—means each component can scale, fail, and be updated independently without cascading failures. The other options conflate physical security, hardware trust, and IAM usage with application architecture best practices.

question: Amazon Glacier is an Amazon S3 storage class that is suitable for storing [...] & [...]. (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 Glacier is designed for data that is infrequently accessed but must be retained for long periods. Active archives (data kept for compliance or historical reference) and long-term analytic data (retained for future analysis) are the primary use cases. Dynamic website assets require fast, frequent access (use S3 Standard); active databases require real-time read/write (use RDS/DynamoDB); cached data requires sub-millisecond access (use ElastiCache).

question: What does Amazon Elastic Beanstalk provide?

options.A: A PaaS solution to automate application deployment.
options.B: A compute engine for Amazon ECS.
options.C: A scalable file storage solution for use with AWS and on-premises servers.

explanation: AWS Elastic Beanstalk is a PaaS offering that automatically handles deployment, capacity provisioning, load balancing, auto-scaling, and application health monitoring—developers upload their application code and Beanstalk manages the rest. It is not a compute engine for ECS, a file storage solution, or a NoSQL database.

question: What is the AWS service that performs automated network assessments of Amazon EC2 instances to check for vulnerabilities?
explanation: Amazon Inspector is an automated vulnerability assessment service that analyzes EC2 instances for software vulnerabilities, unintended network exposure, and deviations from security best practices. Kinesis processes streaming data; security groups control network access; NACLs filter subnet-level traffic—none perform automated security assessments of instance software.

question: Your application has recently experienced significant global growth, and international users are complaining of high latency. What is the AWS characteristic that can help improve your international users’ experience?
explanation: AWS's Global reach—its worldwide network of Regions and edge locations—enables applications to be deployed closer to international users, reducing the network distance that data must travel and lowering latency. Elasticity addresses capacity changes; data durability addresses data protection; high availability addresses uptime, not geographic proximity.

question: A company has business critical workloads hosted on AWS and they are unwilling to accept any downtime. Which of the following is a recommended best practice to protect their workloads in the event of an unexpected natural disaster?

options.A: Replicate data across multiple Edge Locations worldwide and use Amazon CloudFront to perform automatic failover in the event of an outage.
options.B: Deploy AWS resources across multiple Availability Zones within the same AWS Region.
options.C: Create point-in-time backups in another subnet and recover this data when a disaster occurs.
options.D: Deploy AWS resources to another AWS Region and implement an Active-Active disaster recovery strategy.

explanation: Deploying resources to a geographically separate AWS Region and running an Active-Active disaster recovery strategy means both Regions serve production traffic simultaneously, so if a natural disaster takes out one Region, the other continues without downtime. Multi-AZ within a single Region doesn't protect against a Region-wide disaster; edge locations and subnets don't provide full workload redundancy.

question: Which statement is correct with regards to AWS service limits? (Choose TWO)

options.A: You can contact AWS support to increase the service limits.
options.B: Each IAM user has the same service limit.
options.C: There are no service limits on AWS.
options.D: You can use the AWS Trusted Advisor to monitor your service limits.
options.E: The Amazon Simple Email Service is responsible for sending email notifications when usage approaches a service limit.

explanation: AWS service limits (quotas) can be increased by submitting a support request to AWS, and AWS Trusted Advisor monitors your current usage against service limits and alerts you when you approach them. Service limits exist for all AWS accounts; they are not per-IAM-user; SNS is not responsible for service limit alerts.

question: What is the AWS tool that enables you to use scripts to manage all AWS services and resources?
explanation: The AWS CLI (Command Line Interface) is a unified tool that enables you to manage AWS services and automate tasks via scripts and command-line commands. The AWS Console is the web UI; Service Catalog manages approved product portfolios; OpsWorks is a configuration management service using Chef/Puppet.

question: What are the connectivity options that can be used to build hybrid cloud architectures? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS Direct Connect establishes a dedicated private physical connection between on-premises infrastructure and AWS, and AWS VPN creates an encrypted tunnel over the public internet—both are the standard options for building hybrid cloud connectivity. Artifact provides compliance documents; Cloud9 is a browser-based IDE; CloudTrail logs API activity.

question: A company has deployed a new web application on multiple Amazon EC2 instances. Which of the following should they use to ensure that the incoming HTTP traffic is distributed evenly across the instances?
explanation: An Application Load Balancer (ALB) operates at Layer 7 (HTTP/HTTPS) and distributes incoming web traffic across EC2 instances based on rules such as URL path or host header. EC2 Auto Recovery restores individual instances; AWS Auto Scaling adjusts the number of instances; Network Load Balancer operates at Layer 4 and is optimized for TCP/UDP traffic, not general HTTP distribution.

question: Which of the following AWS offerings is a MySQL-compatible relational database service that can scale capacity automatically based on demand?
explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible managed relational database that automatically scales storage as needed. Neptune is a graph database; RDS for SQL Server and RDS for PostgreSQL are managed relational engines but do not auto-scale storage the way Aurora does.

question: What is the AWS data warehouse service that supports a high level of query performance on large amounts of datasets?
explanation: Amazon Redshift is a fully managed, petabyte-scale data warehouse optimized for complex analytical queries on large structured datasets using columnar storage and massively parallel processing. Kinesis handles real-time streaming data; DynamoDB is a NoSQL database for key-value and document workloads; RDS is a transactional relational database.

question: A customer spent a lot of time configuring a newly deployed Amazon EC2 instance. After the workload increases, the customer decides to provision another EC2 instance with an identical configuration. How can the customer achieve this?

options.A: By creating an AWS Config template from the old instance and launching a new instance from it.
options.B: By creating an EBS Snapshot of the old instance.
options.C: By installing Aurora on EC2 and launching a new instance from it.
options.D: By creating an AMI from the old instance and launching a new instance from it.

explanation: Creating an Amazon Machine Image (AMI) from a configured EC2 instance captures its OS, software, and settings as a reusable template, allowing you to launch new instances with identical configurations at any time. AWS Config templates manage compliance rules, not instance images; EBS Snapshots back up volumes but are not a complete instance template; Aurora is a database service.

question: What are the benefits of using the Amazon Relational Database Service? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Complete control over the underlying host.
options.D: Scales automatically to larger or smaller instance types.
options.E: Supports the document and key-value data structure.

explanation: Amazon RDS reduces the administrative burden of database management (backups, patching, failover) and allows you to resize compute capacity (instance type) to match workload needs. RDS does not give complete control over the underlying host (that requires EC2), does not auto-scale to larger instance types, and supports SQL (relational), not document/key-value structures (that is DynamoDB).

question: Which AWS service or feature can be used to call AWS Services from different programming languages?
explanation: AWS SDKs (Software Development Kits) are available for multiple programming languages (Python, Java, JavaScript, .NET, Go, etc.) and provide libraries to interact with AWS services programmatically from within application code. The CLI is for command-line scripts; CodeDeploy automates application deployments; the Management Console is a web UI.

question: Which AWS Service can be used to register a new domain name?
explanation: Amazon Route 53 is the AWS service that provides domain name registration in addition to DNS routing, health checks, and traffic management. Personalize is an ML recommendation service; KMS manages encryption keys; Config tracks resource configurations—none handle domain registration.

question: App development companies move their business to AWS to reduce time-to-market and improve customer satisfaction, what are the AWS automation tools that help them deploy their applications faster? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS CloudFormation lets teams define infrastructure as code in templates that can be version-controlled and deployed automatically, while AWS Elastic Beanstalk abstracts infrastructure management so developers can deploy applications by uploading code—both accelerate deployment. Migration Hub tracks migration progress; IAM manages permissions; Macie discovers sensitive data in S3.

question: Which of the following AWS services scale automatically without your intervention? (Choose TWO)
explanation: Amazon S3 automatically scales to handle any amount of data and any request rate without manual intervention. AWS Lambda scales automatically from zero to thousands of concurrent executions in response to events. EC2 requires Auto Scaling configuration to scale; EMR requires manual cluster resizing; EBS volumes must be manually resized.

question: A company is planning to migrate an application from Amazon EC2 to AWS Lambda to use a serverless architecture. Which of the following will be the responsibility of AWS after migration? (Choose TWO)
explanation: After migrating to AWS Lambda, AWS takes full responsibility for capacity management (scaling functions automatically based on demand) and operating system maintenance (Lambda runs on AWS-managed infrastructure). The customer retains responsibility for application management, access control, and data management.

question: How do ELBs improve the reliability of your application?

options.A: By distributing traffic across multiple S3 buckets.
options.B: By replicating data to multiple availability zones.
options.D: By ensuring that only healthy targets receive traffic.

explanation: Elastic Load Balancers continuously monitor the health of registered targets and only route traffic to instances that pass health checks, ensuring unhealthy targets do not receive requests. ELBs distribute traffic across instances, not S3 buckets; data replication is handled by services like RDS Multi-AZ; read replicas are a database feature.

question: A customer is planning to move billions of images and videos to be stored on Amazon S3. The customer has approximately 60 Petabytes of data to move. Which of the following AWS Services is the best choice to transfer the data to AWS?
explanation: AWS Snowmobile is an exabyte-scale data transfer service delivered as a 45-foot ruggedized shipping container, designed to migrate extremely large datasets (up to 100 PB per Snowmobile). For 60 PB of data, Snowmobile is the appropriate choice. Snowball handles up to 80 TB per device; S3 Transfer Acceleration uses the internet and is not suitable for petabyte-scale migrations; VPC is a networking service.

question: A company needs to track resource changes using the API call history. Which AWS service can help the company achieve this goal?
explanation: AWS CloudTrail records every API call made in your AWS account, including the identity of the caller, timestamp, and parameters, making it the primary service for tracking resource changes via API history.

question: What are the benefits of using an AWS-managed service? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Provides complete control over the virtual infrastructure.
options.B: Allows customers to deliver new solutions faster.
options.D: Eliminates the need to encrypt data.
options.E: Allows developers to control all patching related activities.

explanation: AWS managed services handle infrastructure provisioning, patching, and maintenance, which lowers operational complexity for customers and lets them deliver new solutions faster by focusing on application logic instead of infrastructure management.

question: Which of the following are use cases for Amazon S3? (Choose TWO)

options.B: Hosting websites that require sustained high CPU utilization.
options.D: A media store for the CloudFront service.
options.E: Processing data streams at any scale.

explanation: Amazon S3 can host static websites by serving HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files directly, and it also serves as an origin store for Amazon CloudFront, delivering media content globally through edge caching.

question: What is the benefit of using an API to access AWS Services?

options.A: It improves the performance of AWS resources.
options.B: It reduces the time needed to provision AWS resources.
options.C: It reduces the number of developers necessary.
options.D: It allows for programmatic management of AWS resources.

explanation: AWS APIs enable programmatic management of AWS resources, allowing developers to automate provisioning, configuration, and monitoring through code rather than manual console interactions.

question: A company is planning to migrate a database with high read/write activity to AWS. What is the best storage option to use?
explanation: Amazon EBS provides high-performance block storage volumes that attach directly to EC2 instances, delivering the low-latency I/O needed for databases with high read/write activity.

question: What is the AWS service that provides five times the performance of a standard MySQL database?
explanation: Amazon Aurora is a MySQL and PostgreSQL-compatible relational database that delivers up to five times the throughput of standard MySQL, with the reliability and availability of a commercial database at a fraction of the cost.

question: What does AWS Service Catalog provide?

options.A: It enables customers to quickly find descriptions and use cases for AWS services.
options.B: It enables customers to explore the different catalogs of AWS services.
options.C: It simplifies organizing and governing commonly deployed IT services.
options.D: It allows developers to deploy infrastructure on AWS using familiar programming languages.

explanation: AWS Service Catalog allows organizations to create and manage approved catalogs of IT services, enabling standardized governance and self-service deployment of commonly used resources.

question: For managed services like Amazon DynamoDB, which of the below is AWS responsible for? (Choose TWO)
explanation: For fully managed services like Amazon DynamoDB, AWS is responsible for patching the database software and maintaining the underlying operating system, removing those operational burdens from the customer.

question: Which of the following AWS Services helps with planning application migration to the AWS Cloud?
explanation: AWS Application Discovery Service collects information about on-premises servers, including configuration, usage, and dependencies, to help plan and prioritize migration to the AWS Cloud.

question: Which of the following are factors in determining the appropriate database technology to use for a specific workload? (Choose TWO)

options.C: The number of reads and writes per second.

explanation: The number of reads and writes per second determines throughput requirements, and the nature of the queries (relational joins vs. key-value lookups) determines whether a relational or NoSQL database is the better fit.

question: What are the benefits of implementing a tagging strategy for AWS resources? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Quickly identify resources that belong to a specific project.
options.B: Quickly identify software solutions on AWS.
options.C: Track API calls in your AWS account.
options.D: Quickly identify deleted resources and their metadata.
options.E: Track AWS spending across multiple resources.

explanation: Tags are key-value metadata pairs that let you quickly identify which resources belong to specific projects and track AWS spending across those resources for cost allocation and organizational clarity.

question: What are AWS shared controls?

options.A: Controls that are solely the responsibility of the customer based on the application they are deploying within AWS services.
options.B: Controls that a customer inherits from AWS.
options.C: Controls that apply to both the infrastructure layer and customer layers.
options.D: Controls that the customer and AWS collaborate together upon to secure the infrastructure.

explanation: Shared controls are responsibilities where both AWS and the customer collaborate, each applying controls in their respective domain. For example, AWS patches its infrastructure while the customer patches their guest OS.

question: Which design principles relate to performance efficiency in AWS? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Build multi-region architectures to better serve global customers.
options.C: Implement strong Identity and Access controls.

explanation: Multi-region architectures serve global customers with lower latency, and serverless architectures automatically scale to match demand without capacity planning. Both are key design principles of the Performance Efficiency pillar.

question: Which of the following is NOT a characteristic of Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2)?

options.A: Amazon EC2 is considered a Serverless Web Service.
options.B: Amazon EC2 eliminates the need to invest in hardware upfront.
options.C: Amazon EC2 can launch as many or as few virtual servers as needed.

explanation: Amazon EC2 provides virtual servers that you manage, including the operating system and software stack. It is not serverless. AWS Lambda is the serverless compute service.

question: What is the AWS Compute service that executes code only when triggered by events?
explanation: AWS Lambda is a serverless compute service that runs your code in response to events such as HTTP requests, file uploads, or database changes, without requiring you to provision or manage servers.

question: Both AWS and traditional IT distributors provide a wide range of virtual servers to meet their customers’ requirements. What is the name of these virtual servers in AWS?
explanation: Amazon EC2 instances are virtual servers in the AWS Cloud that provide resizable compute capacity, allowing customers to run applications on AWS infrastructure just as they would on physical servers.

question: Which of the following activities supports the Operational Excellence pillar of the AWS Well-Architected Framework?

options.A: Using AWS Trusted Advisor to find underutilized resources.
options.B: Using AWS CloudTrail to record user activities.
options.C: Using AWS CloudFormation to manage infrastructure as code.
options.D: Deploying an application in multiple Availability Zones.

explanation: AWS CloudFormation supports Operational Excellence by managing infrastructure as code, enabling repeatable deployments, version-controlled changes, and automated rollbacks that improve operational processes.

question: What are the benefits of using DynamoDB? (Choose TWO)

options.A: Automatically scales to meet required throughput capacity.
options.B: Provides resizable instances to match the current demand.
options.C: Supports both relational and non-relational data models.
options.E: Supports the most popular NoSQL database engines such as CouchDB and MongoDB.

explanation: Amazon DynamoDB automatically scales throughput capacity to handle traffic fluctuations, and delivers consistent single-digit millisecond latency at any scale, making it ideal for high-performance applications.

question: As part of the AWS Migration Acceleration Program (MAP), what does AWS provide to accelerate Enterprise adoption of AWS? (Choose TWO)
explanation: The AWS Migration Acceleration Program (MAP) provides AWS Partners for hands-on migration expertise and AWS Professional Services for strategic guidance, both working together to accelerate enterprise cloud adoption.

question: Which AWS service can be used to send promotional text messages (SMS) to more than 200 countries worldwide?
explanation: Amazon Simple Notification Service (SNS) supports sending SMS text messages to over 200 countries, in addition to push notifications and email, making it the right choice for promotional messaging at scale.

question: Which of the following allows you to create new RDS instances? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS CloudFormation can define and provision RDS instances through infrastructure-as-code templates, and the AWS Management Console provides a graphical interface for creating RDS instances directly.

question: A company is using EC2 Instances to run their e-commerce site on the AWS platform. If the site becomes unavailable, the company will lose a significant amount of money for each minute the site is unavailable. Which design principle should the company use to minimize the risk of an outage?
explanation: Fault tolerance is the ability of a system to continue operating without interruption when one or more components fail, which is achieved through redundancy across Availability Zones and automatic failover.

question: What features does AWS offer to help protect your data in the Cloud? (Choose TWO)
explanation: AWS offers access control through IAM policies, security groups, and NACLs to restrict who can reach your data, and data encryption (at rest and in transit) to protect data even if it is intercepted or accessed without authorization.

question: What is the AWS Support feature that allows customers to manage support cases programmatically?
explanation: The AWS Support API allows customers to create, update, and resolve support cases programmatically, enabling integration with internal ticketing systems and automated incident workflows.

question: Which of the following Amazon RDS features facilitates offloading of database read activity?
explanation: Amazon RDS Read Replicas create read-only copies of your database that handle read queries, offloading read traffic from the primary instance and improving overall application performance.

question: How does AWS notify customers about security and privacy events pertaining to AWS services?
explanation: AWS publishes Security Bulletins to notify customers about security and privacy events affecting AWS services, providing details on vulnerabilities and recommended actions.

question: A company has a web application that is hosted on a single EC2 instance and is approaching 100 percent CPU Utilization during peak loads. Rather than scaling the server vertically, the company has decided to deploy three Amazon EC2 instances in parallel and to distribute traffic across the three servers. What AWS Service should the company use to distribute the traffic evenly?
explanation: An Application Load Balancer (ALB) distributes incoming HTTP/HTTPS traffic across multiple EC2 instances, automatically routing requests to healthy targets and balancing the load evenly.

question: Which of the following approaches will help you eliminate human error and automate the process of creating and updating your AWS environment?

options.B: Use AWS CodeDeploy to build and automate your AWS environment.
options.C: Use code to provision and operate your AWS infrastructure.
options.D: Migrate all of your applications to a dedicated host.
